Allison Taylor Smith, a daughter of Marianne and Roy Smith of Upper Montclair, N.J., was married yesterday to Brian Matthew Fernandez, a son of Judith and Douglas Fernandez of Wethersfield, Conn. The Rev. Dale Elizabeth Dealtrey, a Presbyterian minister, officiated at the Ryland Inn in Whitehouse, N.J.
Mr. and Mrs. Fernandez graduated from Drew University, where they met.

The bride, 29, was a paralegal until May at Riker, Danzig, Scherer, Hyland & Perretti, a law firm in Morristown, N.J. Next month, she is to become the assistant to the fund-raising director at the United States Equestrian Team in Gladstone, N.J. The bride is a nationally ranked amateur equestrian at the hunter-jumper level.

Her father, a former partner in Goldman, Sachs & Company, the New York investment bank, is a professor of finance at the Stern School of Business at New York University. The bride is a granddaughter of the late Henry H. Fowler, who was the secretary of the treasury from 1965 to 1969.

The bridegroom, 28, is a financial planner in the Clark, N.J., office of Axa Advisors, a unit of Axa, the French insurance and financial services company. Mr. Fernandez's father is the owner of Turnpike Motors, an automotive and truck-repair business in Newington, Conn.
